pages:
STATE OF MICHIGAN
GRETCHEN WHITMER DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES ELIZABETH HERTEL
GOVERNOR LANSING DIRECTOR
May 18, 2022
Cathey Prudhomme
Eagle Village Inc
4507 170th Avenue
Hersey, MI 49639
RE: License #: CI670411576
Investigation #: 2022C0227002
Eagle Village – Leppien
Dear Ms. Prudhomme:
Attached is the Special Investigation Report for the above referenced facility. Due to the violations
identified in the report, a written corrective action plan is required. The corrective action plan is
due 15 days from the date of this letter and must include the following:
 How compliance with each rule will be achieved.
 Who is directly responsible for implementing the corrective action for each
violation.
 Specific time frames for each violation as to when the correction will be completed
or implemented.
 How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is achieved.
 The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you desire technical assistance in addressing these issues, please feel free to contact me. In
any event, the corrective action plan is due within 15 days. Failure to submit an acceptable
corrective action plan will result in disciplinary action.
Please review the enclosed documentation for accuracy and contact me with any questions. In
the event that I am not available, and you need to speak to someone immediately, please contact
area manager Jessica VandenHeuvel at (616) 204-6992.
Sincerely,
Jennifer Pastorick, Licensing Consultant
MDHHS\Division of Child Welfare Licensing
305 Ludington St.
Escanaba, MI 49829
(906) 280-3979
enclosure

MICHIGAN DEPARTMENT OF HEALTH AND HUMAN SERVICES
DIVISION OF CHILD WELFARE LICENSING
SPECIAL INVESTIGATION REPORT
I. IDENTIFYING INFORMATION
License #: CI670411576
Investigation #: 2022C0227002
Complaint Receipt Date: 04/18/2022
Investigation Initiation Date: 04/18/2022
Report Due Date: 06/17/2022
Licensee Name: Eagle Village Inc
Licensee Address: 4507 170th Avenue
Hersey, MI 49639
Licensee Telephone #: (231) 832-2234
Administrator: Cathey Prudhomme, Administrator
Licensee Designee: Cathey Prudhomme, Designee
Name of Facility: Eagle Village - Leppien
Facility Address: 17106 West Village Road
Hersey, MI 49639
Facility Telephone #: (231) 832-7245
Original Issuance Date: 02/07/2022
License Status: REGULAR
Effective Date: 02/07/2022
Expiration Date: 08/06/2022
Capacity: 15
Program Type: CHILD CARING INSTITUTION, PRIVATE
1

II. ALLEGATION(S)
Violation
Established?
On 4/15/22, youth became upset with a staff member and Yes
punched Staff 1 several times. Staff 1 responded by swinging
their arms and pushing youth to the ground. Youth responded
with aggression towards Staff 1 once more and was restrained.
Staff 1 initially refused to switch out from the hold with another
staff. Youth's head hurt following this.
Additional Findings Yes
The fruit is rotten and has black mold on it. No
Staff member talks about using marijuana with the youth and has Yes
told youth that they could use his vape. Staff 1 shares personal
information with youth.
III. METHODOLOGY
04/18/2022 Special Investigation Intake
2022C0227002
04/18/2022 Special Investigation Initiated - Telephone
Phone Call with MDHHS Worker
04/18/2022 Contact - Telephone call made
Notification to foster care worker
04/19/2022 Inspection Completed On-site
Interviewed youth and Staff with MDHHS Worker and Law
Enforcement
04/27/2022 Contact- Telephone call made
Interview youth with MDHHS Worker via TEAMS Meeting
04/29/2022 Contact- Face to Face
Interview youth and staff with MDHHS Worker
05/02/2022 Contact- Face to Face
Interview youth and staff with MDHHS Worker
05/13/2022 Contact-Face to Face
Interview youth and staff via TEAMS meeting.
05/13/2022 Pre-Exit Conference with Vice President of the Treatment Program
ALLEGATION:
On 4/15/22, youth became upset with a staff member and punched Staff 1 several
times. Staff 1 responded by swinging their arms and pushing youth to the ground.
Youth responded with aggression towards Staff 1 once more and was restrained.
Staff 1 initially refused to switch out from the hold with another staff. Youth's head
hurt following this.

INVESTIGATION:
Youth A was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/19/2022 in collaboration
with MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement. Youth A reported being upset due to
not being able to get a hold of her mentor for a visit that was scheduled the following
day. Youth A was sitting in the living room area when Staff 1 entered the living room
and sat down. Youth A reported she was verbalizing why she was upset when Staff
1 interrupted her and asked Staff 2 and Staff 3 when they would be doing end of the
shift debrief. Youth A reported she told Staff 1 she was upset, and he was smiling.
Youth A reported she got up and tried to hit Staff 1. Youth A reported Staff 1
slammed her on the ground. Youth A was unable to describe how she was
slammed to the ground as she reported it happened so fast. Youth A reported she
got up and began hitting Staff 1 again. Youth A reported Staff 1 restrained her.
Youth A was unable to describe where Staff 1’s hands were during the restraint as
she stated she was not sure as it was traumatizing to her. Youth A reported Staff 1
was laughing at her during the restraint, and she asked Staff 3 to switch Staff 1 out
of the restraint. Youth A reported Staff 3 switched Staff 1 out of the restraint and
Staff 1 walked down the hall. Youth A reported she did not have any injuries from
hitting her head.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/19/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement. Staff 1 reported he entered the living room
and asked Staff 3 if they were going to shift debrief. Staff 1 reported Youth A was in
the living room and told him not to ask questions that he already knows the answers
too. Staff 1 responded to Youth A and told her that he was talking to Staff 3. Staff 1
reported Youth A told him if he laughed or smiled again, she was going to hit him.
Staff 1 reported Youth A ran up swinging at him. Youth A hit him in the head
approximately 5 times. Staff 1 reported he was sitting at the table, and he stood up
to back away from Youth A. Staff 1 reported he ducked a punch. Staff 1 reported
pushing Youth A. Staff 1 described Youth A was on his left side, and he put his arm
out, pushed her, Youth A fell to the ground and hit her head on the floor. Staff 1
reported Youth A got up and began attempting to hit him again. Staff 1 reported
Staff 3 attempted to restrain Youth A, however, she got out of the hold. Staff 1
described turning Youth A’s body and placing her in a benevolent hold. Staff 1
reported he had Youth A in the benevolent hold for 2-3 minutes when Staff 3 said for
him to transition out. Staff 1 transitioned out of the hold and Staff 3 continued with
the standing benevolent hold. Staff 1 went down the hall.
Staff 2 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/19/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker and Law Enforcement. Staff 2 reported all the youth were in their
rooms for the night except Youth A who was sitting in the living room. Staff 2
reported Youth A was frustrated as she was trying to contact her mentor regarding a
visit the following day. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 entered the living room and asked if
they were going to debrief before the end of shift. Staff 2 reported this upset Youth
A and Youth A began yelling at Staff 1. Staff 2 reported Staff 1 laughed it off and
Youth A told Staff 1 that it was not funny and that this was his first warning. Staff 2
3

reported Staff 1 laughed it off again and Youth A got up and stormed at Staff 1. Staff
2 reported Staff 1 was sitting by a wall and a table and began blocking his head and
backing himself into the corner while Youth A was hitting him. Staff 2 reported Staff
1 put his arm out while Youth A was hitting him. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 was trying
to get in between Staff 1 and Youth A. Staff 2 reported Youth A jumped on Staff 1’s
back. Staff 1 shrugged his shoulder and Youth A fell off and hit the ground. Staff 2
reported Youth A got up and went towards Staff 1 and began trying to hit Staff 1.
Staff 1 was able to reposition and put Youth A in an Aegis benevolent hold. Staff 2
described this hold as Youth A’s left arm was up, her right arm was down, and Staff
1 had his hands placed on Youth A’s back in a seated position. Staff 2 reported
Youth A was making statements and threats to Staff 1 and Staff 1 asked Staff 3 to
switch him out of the restraint. Staff 2 reported Staff 3 transitioned Youth A into a
standing benevolent hold. Staff 2 did not feel that Staff 1 forcefully pushed Youth A.
Staff 2 reported he felt the situation was unprovoked and Staff 1 did not do anything
wrong. Staff 2 reported Youth A did not complain of any injury.
Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D were interviewed separately via TEAMS meeting on
4/27/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth B, Youth C, and Youth D
reported not being in the area during the restraint. All reported that they heard about
the restraint however did not see it occur. Youth B added that she heard banging
and walked out to see what was happening. Youth B reported Youth A was holding
the phone about to throw it and Staff 1 was laughing. Youth B reported being
redirected back to her room. Youth B reported coming back out of her room and
seeing Youth A in a restraint with Staff 1. Youth B described the restraint as Youth
A’s arms behind her and Staff 1’s arms scooped under Youth A’s underarm. Youth
B reported Staff 1 was switched out of the restraint by Staff 3. Youth C additionally
reported Staff 1 walked down the hall after the restraint and was smiling.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/2/2022. Youth E reported
she did not see the restraint.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/29/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported he was sitting at the table talking to Youth A who
was upset and sharing her frustrations. Staff 1 interrupted Youth A and asked Staff
3 if they were going to shift debrief. Staff 3 reported this upset Youth A and Staff 1
chuckled and told Youth A he was not talking to her. Staff 3 reported Youth A got up
and went towards Staff 1 and began punching him in the head. Staff 1 was covering
his head from the punches. Staff 3 described trying to use his body to create space
between Youth A and Staff 1 by getting between Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 3
attempted to get Youth A in a restraint however Youth A was able to get away. Staff
3 reported Youth A ran back at Staff 1 and Staff 1 did a sweeping motion with his
right arm causing Youth A to fall to the ground. Staff 3 described this as Staff 1
extending his arm out and moving it from being directly out to his right side to being
in front of his body. Staff 3 reported Youth A got back up and began climbing to
stand on a chair and attempted to throw a Gatorade bottle at Staff 1. Staff 1 placed
Youth A in a restraint. Staff 3 described the restraint as starting as a standing
4

benevolent restraint and then Staff 1 transitioned to a benevolent seated safety
position. Staff 3 reported he switched Staff 1 out of the restraint at this time to
remove Staff 1 from the area in attempt to de-escalate Youth A. Staff 3 reported
Staff 1 went down the hall. Staff 3 reported Youth A was never on Staff 1’s back.
MDHHS worker has no findings in this investigation.
Video Reviewed:
Video footage of 04/15/2022 in the Leppien home was unable to be viewed due to
the camera system being down at that time.
Documents Reviewed
 Incident Report dated 4/15/2022 was not consistent with Staff 1, Staff 2 and
Youth A’s interview. The incident report does not state that Youth A was
pushed causing her to fall to the ground and hit her head. The incident report
states Youth A was punching Staff 1. Staff 2 and Staff 3 attempted to use
proximity control to put space between Youth A and Staff 1. Staff 1 initiated a
benevolent restraint to keep himself safe.
 Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating Procedures 4.2
Therapeutic Holds. Pushing a youth is not a therapeutic hold.
 Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating Procedures 3.6
Behavior Plans. Pushing a youth is not listed in the behavior plans.
 Written statement by Staff 1 dated 4/18/2022. The written statement
indicates Youth A got out of her chair and swung at Staff 1. Staff 1 indicated
“I ducked one of them and threw her off me and she ended up on her side
where she bumped her head.”
 Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Staff 1
completed required Aegis Training on 3/9/2022, 3/10/2022, and 3/15/2022.
Staff 1 also completed the Aegis de-escalation training test and passed.
 Approval Request CCI Rule 400.4128(5) letter indicates all direct care staff
receive a minimum of 14 hours initial training before being authorized to use
Aegis.
 Staff 2’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Staff 2
completed required Aegis Training on 3/9/2022, 3/10/2022, and 3/15/2022.
 Staff 3’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary record and Staff 3
completed required Aegis Training on 12/17/2021, 12/20/2021, and
12/22/202.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4157 Behavior management.
(1) An institution shall establish and follow written policies and
procedures that describe the institution’s behavior management
system. The policies and procedures shall be reviewed annually
5

and updated as needed. These shall be available to all
residents, their families, and referring agencies.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in non-compliance as Staff 1 reported
pushing Youth A away from him causing her to fall and hit her
head on the ground.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
The fruit is rotten and has black mold on it.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth C was interviewed via TEAMS Meeting on 4/27/2022 and face-to-face at the
facility on 4/29/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C reported he does
not like the food at the facility. Youth C reported the fruit that is in the fruit bowl in
the house is rotten and has black mold on it. Youth C described rotten fruit as fruit
with bruises on it. Youth C reported the fruit was brought to the house the same day
he took out a piece of fruit that had black mold on it. Youth C reported he informed
staff. Youth C reported staff and youth throw fruit away when they notice it to be
rotting. Youth C reported this has occurred 3 times.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/2/2022. Youth E did not
have any concerns about the food or fruit.
Administrator 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/29/2022 in
collaboration with the MDHHS worker. Administrator 1 reported fresh fruit is
delivered to the house twice a week. Administrator 1 reported being informed by a
staff member that there was some rotten fruit in the home and Administrator 1
advised staff to throw away any fruit that is getting moldy in the fruit bowl when they
notice it.
Staff 1 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/2/2022 in collaboration with
the MDHHS worker. Staff 1 reported no knowledge of rotten fruit or concerns with
the fruit in the home.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/29/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported there has been a couple of times where the fruit in
the fruit bowl will begin to rot and staff or youth will throw the fruit away. Staff 3
reported this rarely occurs.
MDHHS worker has no findings in this investigation.
Tour Observation:
Leppien House was toured on 4/29/2022 and the fruit bowl was observed to have
fresh fruit that was not rotten.
6

APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4149 Resident nutrition
(1) A licensee shall provide a minimum of 3 nutritious edible
meals daily unless medically contraindicated and documented.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in compliance with resident nutrition. Fresh
fruit is delivered to the home twice a week. There are times the
fruit is not eaten and will begin to get moldy and bruised. Youth
and staff throw the fruit away when it is noticed. The fruit bowl
was observed on 4/29/2022 to be full of fresh fruit.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION NOT ESTABLISHED
ALLEGATION:
Staff 1 talks about using marijuana with the youth and has told youth that they could
use his vape. Staff 1 shares personal information with youth.
INVESTIGATION:
Youth B was interviewed via TEAMS meeting on 4/27/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker and on 5/13/2022 via TEAMS meeting. Youth B reported Staff 1
has talked about using marijuana. Youth B reported Staff 1 has told her that he uses
marijuana. Youth B described a closet in the gym at the facility where Staff 1 goes
and she believes he is using a dab pen while in there. Youth B has never seen Staff
1 with a dab pen, however stated Staff 1 exits the gym closet with puffy, bloodshot
eyes, and coughing. Youth B reported there is no smell when Staff 1 comes out of
the closet. Youth B reported this has occurred approximately 10 times. Youth B
shared that she has told Youth E about this as well as Staff 4. Youth B reported Staff
1 showed her and Youth E a video of him smoking marijuana on his phone. Youth B
reported Staff 1 told her that he was fired from his previous job at a marijuana
dispensary for sending a nude photo to a coworker. Youth B reported she told Staff
4 about this. Youth B reported Staff 1 told her that he would let her use his vape.
Youth B, Youth E and Staff 1 were in the gym playing horse when Staff 1 asked
Youth B and Youth E if they smoke marijuana or vape. Youth B reported she told
Staff 1 that she did, and Staff 1 told her that he had a vape. Youth B reported she
asked Staff 1 if she could use his vape and Staff 1 told her not now but tomorrow.
Youth B reported she never used Staff 1’s vape and that Staff 1 wrote an incident
report on her. Youth B reported she saw Staff 1’s vape the day after she asked to
use it as Staff 1 was using it outside when she was with him. Youth B reported no
other youth saw the vape. Youth B reported it was a Breeze disposable vape that
was rectangle and black, red and pink in color.
Youth C was interviewed via TEAMS meeting on 4/27/2022 and face-to-face at the
facility on 4/29/2022 in collaboration with MDHHS worker. Youth C reported he
heard through other youth that Staff 1 offered them a hit off his vape. Youth C
reported hearing this from Youth B, Youth D and Youth E. Youth C asked Staff 1
about this and reported Staff 1 told him that he did not know what Youth C was
7

talking about. Youth C reported Staff 1 was smiling during this conversation. Youth
C reported he is unaware of any conversations involving Staff 1 and marijuana.
Youth D was interviewed via TEAMS meeting on 4/27/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker and 5/13/2022 via TEAMS meeting. Youth D reported Staff 1 told
her he previously worked at the marijuana dispensary in town and nothing more.
Youth D reported Staff 1 talked to the youth about how they should not use
marijuana. Youth D reported not being aware of Staff 1 telling youth they could use
his vape. Youth D reported Staff 1 has shown her a picture on his phone of how long
his hair was once but nothing else. Youth D reported she has never seen Staff 1
with a dab pen or a vape.
Youth E was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 5/2/2022 and via TEAMS
meeting on 5/13/2022. Youth E reported Staff 1 talks to youth like they are friends
and feels this is due to Staff 1 being younger and close to the youth’s age. Youth E
reported Staff 1 offered her and Youth B a vape while they were in the gym. Youth
E reported she did not see the vape. Youth E reported going back to Leppien house
with Staff 1 and Youth B and there was no further discussion about the vape. Youth
E reported she heard later that an incident report was written about the situation.
Youth E reported Staff 1 previously worked at the marijuana dispensary in town and
that Staff 1 told her that he was fired due to having a relationship with a coworker
who stated he was harassing her. Youth E reported Staff 1 showed her a picture of
the former coworker on Facebook and told her that he did sexual things with his
former coworker. Youth E reported Staff 1 did not go into detail regarding what he
meant about sexual things. Youth E reported Staff 1 asked her if she did drugs.
Youth E reported Staff 1 told her that he smokes after work however did not clarify
what he smoked. Youth E reported Staff 1 showed her a video on Instagram of when
he got arrested. Youth E described the video showed police cars and Staff 1 in
handcuffs. Youth E reported Staff 1 has not shown her pictures of him using
marijuana. Youth E reported she heard from Youth B that Staff 1 would go into the
gym closet and come out high, however Youth E reported she never saw this occur.
Youth E reported she has smelled marijuana on Staff 1 before however was unable
to recall when.
Youth F was interviewed face-to-face via TEAMS meeting on 5/13/2022. Youth F
reported Staff 1 joked around with him about marijuana. Youth F reported he was
stumbling around, and Staff 1 asked him if he was high. Youth F reported he said
“yes” jokingly and him and Staff 1 laughed about it. Youth F reported he has not had
any other conversations with Staff 1 about marijuana. Youth F reported he never
asked Staff 1 if he used marijuana.
Staff 1 was interviewed face to face on 4/29/2022 in collaboration with the MDHHS
worker and on 5/13/2022 via TEAMS meeting. Staff 1 reported that he was asked
by Youth B to buy her a vape and that he documented this via writing an incident
report. Staff 1 reported he was advised by Administrator 1 to write the incident
report. Staff 1 denied buying any youth a vape or offering any youth his vape. Staff
8

1 reported he does vape. Staff 1 reported he uses Breeze disposable vapes. Staff 1
reported he does not have a vape on him when he is working. Staff 1 did not know
why youth would know what type of vape he uses. Staff 1 denied using a dab pen or
vape in the gym closet at the facility. Staff 1 reported that he uses the gym closet to
change cloths at times. Staff 1 reported he has never had a conversation with youth
regarding marijuana. Staff 1 then recalled a time where Youth F asked him if he had
every smoked marijuana and Staff 1 reported he changed the conversation. Staff 1
denied ever coming to work under the influence of marijuana. Staff 1 reported he
may have smelled like marijuana at work due to a household member he resides
with uses marijuana. Staff 1 reported he previously worked at a marijuana
dispensary in town and was fired due to being accused of sexually harassing a
coworker. Staff 1 denies telling this to any youth at the facility. Staff 1 reported he
does not know how youth at the facility would know this. Staff 1 denied showing
youth at the facility any pictures of him on Facebook, Instagram, or videos on his
phone. Staff 1 reported he did show a youth a picture of him when he was in track
as he shared, he was talking to the youth about sports, and they asked if he had
been in any sports. Staff 1 reported that he has been arrested previously, however
denied showing youth any pictures or videos of this. Staff 1 reported youth may
have found an old picture of him on Facebook of the situation from 2017. Staff 1
shared that the picture is blurry, and he is not sure how youth would know that it was
him. Staff 1 then reported he did tell youth that he has been “locked up” and
reported he did not tell youth why. Staff 1 reported telling youth this to discouraging
them from making poor choices.
Staff 3 was interviewed face-to-face at the facility on 4/29/2022 in collaboration with
MDHHS worker. Staff 3 reported Youth B told him that Staff 1 offered her his vape
and then Staff 1 wrote an incident report on Youth B. Staff 3 reported Youth B has a
history of being honest with him. Staff 3 reported not being aware of any marijuana
discussion.
Staff 4 was interviewed via TEAMS meeting on 5/13/2022. Staff 4 reported not
hearing any concerns from Youth B regarding a vape or dab pen being used by Staff
1 at work. Staff 4 reported the female youth at Leppien House have told her that
they do not like Staff 1 however have no specific reason. Staff 4 denied any youth
reporting Staff 1 showing any of his personal pictures and/or videos on his
Facebook, Instagram, or videos. Staff 4 reported having no knowledge of Staff 1’s
prior work history.
MDHHS worker has no findings in this investigation.
Documents Reviewed
 Incident Report dated 3/31/2022 references Youth B asking Staff 1 to buy her
a vape. Staff 1 informed Youth B he would not buy her a vape. The Incident
report notes that Staff 1 completed the incident report after talking to
Administrator 1 confirming proper protocol. The incident report states the
9

exact date and time of the incident could not be recalled. The incident report
was dated 3/31/2022 and completed on 4/2/2022.
 Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating Procedures 6.3
Incident Report which states all incident reported must be written before staff
leave their shift for the day.
 Eagle Village Residential Services Standard Operating Procedures 7.1 Staff
Code of Conduct states:
o Discussing personal business with residents is discouraged unless it is
directly related to the therapeutic benefit and growth of the resident.
Self-disclosure should be brief, and focus should remain on the resident.
If staff have any questions about whether or not such information is
appropriate for the youth, they should withhold such information until
such time that they can solicit feedback from the treatment team,
Residential Team Supervisor, or Family Therapist.
o Staff are prohibited from providing cigarette lighters, cigarettes, vape
pens, chewing tobacco, or any other item/substance that is illegal for a
minor to use or have in their possession.
 Staff 1’s personnel file: There was no disciplinary action on file. Staff 1 received
Incident Report training on 3/15/2022. Boundaries and Code of Conduct training was
received during New Employee Orientation in March 2022.
APPLICABLE RULE
R 400.4109 Program statement
(1) An institution shall have and follow a current written program
statement which specifically addresses all of the following:
(c) Policies and procedures pertaining to admission, care,
safety, and supervision, methods for addressing residents’
needs, implementation of treatment plans, and discharge of
residents.
ANALYSIS: The facility is found in noncompliance as Staff 1 has not
followed the agency’s Operating Procedures for Incident
Reported as well as Code of Conduct. Staff 1 did not complete
the incident report on the date the youth asked him for a vape
as the incident report completion date is 4/2/2022 and the
incident report states the date of the occurrence is unknown.
Staff 1 has shared personal information regarding himself with
youth that was not related to therapeutic benefit.
CONCLUSION: VIOLATION ESTABLISHED
IV. RECOMMENDATION
I recommend upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan no change be
made to the license status of this child caring institution.
10

05/18/2022
________________________________________
Jennifer Pastorick Date
Licensing Consultant
Approved By:
May 18, 2022
________________________________________
Jessica VandenHeuvel Date
Area Manager
11
